results.title: The Horse in the gray flannel suit
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Winston Hibler and Norman Tokar
results.brief_description: An advertising executive under pressure to come up with a winning campaign uses, for inspiration, his daughter’s love of horses. This children’s film, centred on horses and equestrian pursuits, is a family-oriented comedy that stars Dean Jones, Fred Bolton, Diane Baker, Lloyd Bochner, Fred Clark and Ellen Janov.

results.title: The Horse and its relatives
results.creator_credit: Coronet Productions and Chicago Zoological Society
results.brief_description: The horse and has been tamed and used by humans since the days of antiquity. In this film several of the animals b iologically related to the horse are studied, with emphasis on their physical characteristics and their habits in their natural surroundings - the zebra, the South American tapir, and the rhinoceros. These animals are very rarely tamed. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.

results.title: The Horror of it all
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc. and Gene Feldman
results.brief_description: Traces the history and development of the horror film from the beginning of the century up to the 1970’s. The film combines fascinating and rare footage from European and American horror films with a look at changes and recurring themes in these works. Narrated by Jose Ferrer.

results.title: The Hordern mystery
results.brief_description: A crime drama, based on the novel of same title by Edmund Finn, in which a transfer of identity becomes a fraudulent way of gaining a millionaire’s money by bigamously marrying his daughter. Cast includes Godfrey Cass, Thomas Sinclair, Beatrice Hamilton, Claude Turton, Floris StGeorge, Flo Little. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: The Hopi Indian
results.brief_description: Presents the way of life of the Hopi in Arizona’s Grand Canyon. Stresses the degree to which these people have adjusted themselves to a difficult environment, showing their irrigation systems and food crops. Describes the secret marriage ritual of the Hopi Indian from the initial baking of corn for bread making to the final wedding ceremony.

results.title: The Hooley-Dooleys: pop
results.creator_credit: Hooley Dooleys Touring Company and Colin Bromley
results.brief_description: It’s a rainy day and the Hooley Dooleys and their friends Russell the Muscly Kangaroo and Tickle the Doodat are disappointed because they can’t go to the park. Things don’t turn out too badly when they decide to put on a pretend concert in Tickle’s playroom, and they each take it in turns to either entertain or be part of the audience. Features the following songs; “We are the Hooley Dooleys”, “Hello you’ve got the rhythm”, “Ten fingers splashing in the puddles”, “Police car”, “Peek-a-boo ping pong ball”, “Kangaroo”, “Hands and feet sailing”, “The Hooley Dooley’s ball”, “Photograph diddley dee”, “Mowing”, “If I was”, “Drums”, and “Everybody”.

results.title: The Honourable Wally Norman
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Ocean Pictures, Showtime, South Australian Film Corporation, Jonathan Shteinman, Emile Sherman and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: From the world of politics a local hero emerges in the form of a ‘man of the people’ - Wally, Wally Norman (Kevin Harrington). Directed by Ted Emery (Kath & Kim) comes this comedy about the machinations of political life when a country town crucial for a win at the next federal election, finds itself with a dilemma. The local meat works is closed down and sleazy Ken Oath (Shaun Micallef) corrupt politician wants to win at any cost. Local man Wally Norman, unable to give speeches due to extreme fear, finally overcomes his inertia to lead the town he feels passionate about - Givens Head - and they elect their new leader. Set to the strains of Jimmy Barnes “Working Class Man”, this film pokes fun at politicians and is a cheer for the underdog. Opening night film for the Sydney Film Festival 2003. Cast includes Greig Pickhaver and Alan Cassell and was written by Andrew Jones and Rick Kalowski.

results.title: The Honeymooners
results.creator_credit: CBS, Jackie Gleason Enterprises, Jack Hurdle and Frank Satenstein
results.brief_description: The Honeymooners was a popular television comedy that started as a sketch show and due to its success was produced as a series. The live show was set in a Brooklyn apartment focusing on two lower middle class neighbouring couples trying to make their lives better. The main character Ralph (Jackie Gleason), a bus driver, is constantly at loggerheads with his wife, Alice (Audrey Meadows) who always make up by the end of the show. This video presentation includes one episode, “TV or not TV” and a montage tribute of the show presenting highlights and memorable moments. The episode shows what happens when the couples decide to jointly own a television set and the strains it places on their friendship. Interestingly “The Flintstones” cartoon was based on the characters from “The Honeymooners” placing them in a pre-historic setting.

results.title: The Homicide story
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and HSV Channel 7, Melbourne
results.brief_description: The story of the making of one episode of the successful Australian television series - Homicide. From the idea for a story in the mind of a writer to the finished product - a matter of fourteen weeks intensive planning and work. We follow all steps of production: from the writing of the script to the final telerecording of thirty minutes of television.

results.title: The Hometown
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jack Long and Bettina Matzkuhn
results.brief_description: A collection of tapestries designed and sewn by the filmmaker, Bettina Matzkuhn, illustrate the lyrics of a song about a young girl’s hometown. Animation is created through a combination of sewing and cinematic techniques. The needlework, done in a naive style, is well suited to the bright colours and varied textures of the work. A lively film designed to promote interest in the art of tapestry
